intro: Daviesia linearis, commonly known as the slender daviesia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. It is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in regions with mild winters and warm, dry summers. Daviesia linearis is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
